intro: Bryonia tenella, commonly known as the Syrian beggar's-tick, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and squashes. The plant produces yellow flowers and has rough, hairy stems and leaves. Its fruit is a toxic, orange-colored berry that contains several seeds. Bryonia tenella is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine, although its use is limited due to its toxic properties.
